entry.title: Unveiling the future of B2B Commerce - Germany's first Architect Group Meetup explores exciting innovations and upcoming trends
entry.content:
Introduction

The B2B commerce landscape is evolving at a rapid pace, and D√ºsseldorf‚Äôs salesforce architect group took a bold step forward by hosting its first-ever commerce meetup.

Held at the brand-new salesfive office in D√ºsseldorf, the event was an incredible success, bringing together industry professionals, thought leaders, and even representatives from Salesforce. The evening was filled with enriching discussions, networking opportunities, and captivating presentations that shed light on the future of B2B commerce.

1Ô∏è‚É£ The Inaugural Event at salesfive‚Äôs D√ºsseldorf Office

The salesforce Architects Trailblazer Group meetup marked a significant milestone for both the community, salesfive and salesforce itself. Held at our state-of-the-art office in Dusseldorf, this event served as the perfect backdrop for the innovative ideas and conversations that were about to unfold. The attendees were welcomed into a modern, collaborative space that set the tone for an evening of exploration and growth.

2Ô∏è‚É£ Networking with a Twist

While knowledge sharing was at the core of the meetup, attendees also had the opportunity to foster new connections and strengthen existing ones. The atmosphere was buzzing with excitement as architects, developers, and industry experts engaged in lively discussions, exchanged ideas, and built valuable professional relationships. Through casual conversations and interactive activities, attendees discovered the power of networking and its potential for driving future collaborations.

We had a great time during the break-out sessions, they were informative and lots of fun!

üëâüèº A sincere thank you goes out to Philipp Kasprowicz (Lead Commerce & Experience Cloud Competence Center @ Salesfive) and Jakub Santur (Regional Sales Director @ Salesforce) for their invaluable contribution in turning our ideas into a remarkable reality üî•

3Ô∏è‚É£ Salesforce joins the Conversation

To make the event even more impactful, three distinguished representatives from Salesforce joined the architect group meetup. Their presence added immense value, as attendees had the chance to connect directly with individuals who possess in-depth knowledge of the B2B commerce landscape. The interaction with Salesforce experts opened doors to new insights, possibilities, and potential partnerships.

4Ô∏è‚É£ Roadmap of B2B Commerce: Headless Architecture and Sneak Preview

One of the highlights of the evening was an enlightening presentation on the roadmap of B2B commerce. The audience was introduced to the concept of headless architecture, which enables businesses to decouple their front-end presentation layer from the back-end commerce functionality. This approach empowers companies with unparalleled flexibility, scalability, and customization options. Additionally, attendees were treated to an exclusive sneak preview of upcoming developments in B2B commerce, showcasing the cutting-edge advancements that will shape the industry‚Äôs future.

Furthermore, industry expert Rene Kessler (Director Product Management, Commerce Cloud @ salesforce) introduced the audience to Commerce GPT, a revolutionary technology that leverages artificial intelligence to enhance customer experiences, automate processes, and optimize decision-making in the B2B commerce realm. The presentation sparked lively discussions and set the stage for further exploration into the potential of AI in transforming the industry.

5Ô∏è‚É£ Demo: B2B Commerce Checkout, SAP Integration, and Ticket Management with Service Cloud

The architect group meetup also provided a platform for hands-on experiences and practical demonstrations. I had the opportunity to provide attendees with a live demo of B2B commerce checkout, demonstrating the seamless integration with an ERP system and highlighting the remarkable benefits it brings to businesses, including enhanced efficiency, improved accuracy, and increased customer satisfaction. Moreover, the event touched upon the integration of a case management system with Service Cloud, highlighting the importance of streamlined customer support processes.

Conclusion üí•

D√ºsseldorf‚Äôs first Architect Group Meetup was a big success, showing the great potential of B2B commerce and promoting collaboration among architects. The event marked the start of a new era, where professionals from different fields came together to discuss the future of B2B commerce, meet industry leaders, and learn about new technologies. With exciting advancements coming soon and a focus on innovation, the future of B2B commerce looks promising.

Photo Collection

Take a look at this collection of event photos that capture the essence and excitement of our gathering.

entry.title: RSVP to the Germany's first Salesforce Commerce Cloud Group Meeting üí•
entry.content:

üåü Join us for an incredible event on June 14th! Salesfive and Salesforce are teaming up once again to bring you the hottest topics in the industry. Prepare to be inspired and get ready to reshape the future together!

üöÄ Here‚Äôs what‚Äôs in store:
1Ô∏è‚É£ Summer ‚Äò23 Release: Discover the latest and greatest updates that will take your business to new heights. Get a sneak peek into the game-changing features that will fuel your success.

2Ô∏è‚É£ Composable Storefronts and Headless: Unleash the power of next-gen development! Explore innovative concepts that are transforming the digital landscape. Learn how to future-proof your business with flexible and scalable architectures.

3Ô∏è‚É£ B2B Commerce on Lightning Demo: Get blown away by the jaw-dropping capabilities of Salesforce‚Äôs B2B Commerce solution. See firsthand how you can create seamless and personalized experiences for your customers.

ü§ù We‚Äôre thrilled to invite our valued clients and partners to this exclusive event. It‚Äôs not just about business ‚Äî it‚Äôs about building meaningful connections too. Network with industry leaders, exchange ideas, and ignite collaborations that will drive your success.

üóìÔ∏è Save the date and join us on June 14th @ 18:00. Together, let‚Äôs shape the future, set trends, and make waves in the industry. Don‚Äôt miss out on this exciting opportunity!

entry.title: Flow Scanner and Documentator, vsCode Extensions, sfdx Plugins and SWAG üéÅ
entry.content:
Intro

I recently had the pleasure of hosting the fourth meeting of the D√ºsseldorf Architect Group, which took place on March 16th 2023. It was an engaging gathering that showcased the innovative ideas of our talented members.

The highlight of the event was a captivating presentation by Fabian Kramer, a skilled Solution Architect, who delved into the fascinating realm of technology. Titled ‚ÄúFlow Scanner and Documentator, vsCode Extensions & sfdx Plugins‚Äù, his session explored the remarkable capabilities of Flow Scanner and Documentator, vsCode Extensions, and sfdx Plugins.

The presentation sparked enthusiastic discussions and piqued the interest of everyone present. It was truly remarkable to witness the active participation and engagement of our D√ºsseldorf Architect Group members. Their unwavering commitment to sharing new and intriguing insights continues to be a driving force behind the success of our meetings.

With each meeting, our group grows stronger, and I am thrilled to witness the immense potential that lies ahead for the D√ºsseldorf Architect Group. Here‚Äôs to many more fruitful gatherings and an exciting future! Cheers! ü•Ç #ManyMoreToCome

entry.title: How to forceignore a whole folder, except a specific file in your DX Project
entry.content:
Intro to the issue

Have you ever worked with scratch orgs and wondered how you could ignore all changes to a specific folder (e.g Profiles), except to just one specific file in that folder, let‚Äôs say System Admin profile?

The first thing that comes into your mind is copy-pasting all the file paths that you want to ignore, except the one that you want to NOT ignore. This would result on having a lot of lines, making the .forceignore file a lot longer and not so easily readable.

Don‚Äôt rush and do that, because there is a better solution to it üéâ

The Solution

We can use the exclamation point ‚Äú!‚Äù to make the specific exclusion, just like we would use it in our validation rules, apex or in a .gitignore file.

‚¨áÔ∏è Below is the example snippet you could copy into your .forceignore file

So, above we are ignoring every change in every profile, except to the System Admin one.

Example to try out

  1. Add the above snippet to your .forceignore file
  2. Create and open a fresh scratch org
  3. Go to profiles and modify the System Admin and also the Standard User profiles.
  4. Save the changes.
  5. Jump to vscode and pull the changes from your scratch org with:
  6. You will notice that the CLI will only pull the changes to the System Admin profile üôåüèº

You can of course use this example with all other folders and files in your DX project with just a few simple adjusments.

Sources

1Ô∏è‚É£ Salesforce DX Developer Guide
2Ô∏è‚É£ Salesforce Stackexchange
3Ô∏è‚É£ salesforce cli issue

Disclaimer

The articles posted in this blog assume that you already have a deep developer knowledge. This is why I do not explain things more thoroughly, but just give out the solution.

entry.title: My experience as a 1:1 Trailblazer Mentor
entry.content:
How it started

A month ago, before attending #dreamforce, I applied to be a Trailbalzer 1:1 Mentor to help other Trailblazer onboard on the salesforce ecosystem so they can explore new career opportunities. My goal was to make new trailblazers feel welcome in the ecosystem, broaden their network, inspire them and also answer any question that they might have regarding the salesforce career.

Acceptance email & Eligibility criterias

After a couple of days, I got an Email confirming that I have been accepted as a Mentor and that I have been matched with a Mentee.

Hi Enea, Congratulations!
You‚Äôve been accepted as a Trailblazer Mentorship 1:1 Mentor. We‚Äôre excited for you to start your journey as a mentor in the program. You will undoubtedly be an invaluable asset to our job seekers as they pursue their next opportunity in the Salesforce ecosystem.

Trailblazer Connect Mentorship Programme

Here is the link to apply as a Mentor or as a Mentee. At the moment, the Mentor Circles applications are cloosed, but you can apply for a One-on-One Mentorship (same as I did).

Check here the application tips but also the eligibility criterias which are very important.

Being a 1:1 Mentor

As soon as I got the acceptance email, I reached out to my mentee so we could align on the first meeting. As my mentee was in (GMT-5) timezone we had to both agree on a timeline which would suit us best.

She is very motivated and also gaining a lot of experience in Salesforce by completing badges/superbadged weekly.

I support her in the following mentor guidance tasks:

  • support with professional goals
  • create a career plan, review CV, and preparation or mocks for job interviews
  • connect her with recruiters in her region
  • help her out when choosing trailhead modules which are relevant for job interviews
  • answer various questions regarding the career, etc

Tips

I would always suggest to connect your Mentees with their local Trailblazer Groups (Admin, Women in Tech, etc). They are very helpful to extend their network which might lead to them landing a job faster. It also of course increases their confidence. Bonus points if they are active and participate as a speaker, which would look great in the CV.

Helpful Resources (PDF preview works only on Desktop version üìµ)

1Ô∏è‚É£ Trailblazer Mentorship Group, which is very helpful to answer any questions after you have joined the programme

2Ô∏è‚É£ Mentor welcome video to find out more about Mentors

3Ô∏è‚É£ Mentee welcome video to find out more about Mentees

4Ô∏è‚É£ Trailblazer Mentorship Career Resources

5Ô∏è‚É£ Trailblazer Mentor Playbook

6Ô∏è‚É£ Trailblazer Mentorship Mentee Playbook

7Ô∏è‚É£ Here is an FAQ if you are unfamiliar with the Trailbalzer 1:1 Mentorship Programme.

entry.title: My first dreamforce experience
entry.content:
How it started

This year, my company where I work at, salesfive, gave me the possibility to attend dreamforce for the first time ever. This was the first real dreamforce after the two full years of COVID-19 pandemic. It was an amazing experience and I am very lucky that I work in such a company where these opportunities are given to it‚Äôs employees.

In this first blog post ever, I am sharing some pictures that I took during dreamforce.

Hope you all enjoy it üôåüèº

Picture Gallery

Dreamforce Natinal Park

This was taken while walking down the street which takes you to Moscone Center.

Trailblazer Forest where almost all the sessions were held (Moscone West). I spent most of my time here, especially in the ‚ÄúArchitect Vista‚Äù.

ZOHO CRM throwing shade during dreamforce. Iirc, sugar CRM also had a bus with ads going around üòÇ (they can try but they will never be as good as sfdc)

I won these during a raffle (I had the lucky number #614027) ü•≥üòÖ

Salesforce Tower during the night
